metadata.title: CVE-2014-3624 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Apache Traffic Server 5.1.x before 5.1.1 allows remote attackers to bypassaccess restrictions by leveraging failure to properly tunnel remap requestsusing CONNECT.

criterions.comment: trafficserver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
